info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 4 at 8:37PM CDT until April 8 at 5:48AM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Chicago IL has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois...
Iroquois River at Iroquois affecting Iroquois and Newton Counties.
For the Iroquois River...including Iroquois...flooding is possible.
* WHAT...Flooding is possible.
* WHERE...Iroquois River from Near US-41 downstream to confluence with Sugar Creek at Watseka, including the Iroquois gauge.
* WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to early Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Agricultural areas near the river begin to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
A Flood Watch means water levels above flood stage are possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons along rivers and streams in the watch area should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
Exact locations and amounts of rainfall remain uncertain. Heavier rainfall than currently forecasted could lead to an increase in flood severity.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued by 10 AM CDT Saturday morning.Saturday afternoon.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING
